Author: RadioYo
Title: [ANN] RadioYo ICO - Building a decentralized ecosystem for Independent Media...
Body: Hey all - More progress to report on.  RadioYo is excited to announce that we're about to embark on phase two of building out our blockchain-based broadcasting and services platform.  As part of this build-out, we're looking for podcasters/independent journalists/online media who want to participate in a special pilot that will timestamp your information to the blockchain.  For those who are interested in shaping the future direction of RadioYo, what we want to do is to take the information you created or used when you registered as a Host on RadioYo i.e., name and email; statistics; latest biography; press images, social media-style information; organizations/companies connected to, and RSS feed, and upload this information to the blockchain.  It’s our hope that the lessons learned from this pilot will help shape the direction RadioYo takes and makes financially rewarding content creators a reality.  ICO website: https://rao.radioyo.fm Product website: https://radioyo.fm    https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/xq90/924/ks0iH9.jpg

Author: Xandan
Title: [ANN] RadioYo ICO - Building a decentralized ecosystem for Independent Media...
Body: This project was announced almost seven months ago and in all this period there were something done behind the scene for preparation of initial coin offering (ICO). It was told that in first quarter of this year it was start raising funds but I didn't find any patent update on this yet. Are there some changes in initial plan ?

Author: RadioYo
Title: [ANN] RadioYo ICO - Building a decentralized ecosystem for Independent Media...
Body: Thanks for your question.  Our ICO opened on March 1st and is running right now.  Our hard cap is $3.3M.  1 RAO = .10¢ USD.  We have 34 different tiers/packages.  The smallest number of tokens is 500 and the largest is 250,000 tokens.  Our ICO site is https://rao.radioyo.fm.  So, we're meeting the milestones we've set for ourselves.  Not sure what you mean by patent. Are you referring to patenting our technology?  There have been no changes to the initial plan.  Later this week we're going to announce a contest to design our wallet, stay tuned for details and what you can win, and we're also starting to use the IPFS protocol to add podcaster information to the blockchain.  So we are making progress, and I appreciate you taking the time to ask you question.  If you have any other questions I'm always around.  Cheers...       https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/xq90/924/ks0iH9.jpg

Author: RadioYo
Title: [ANN] RadioYo ICO - Building a decentralized ecosystem for Independent Media...
Body: RadioYo is building a decentralized Ecosystem for podcasters, online broadcasters, independent media and online publishers worldwide, using a cutting-edge cryptocurrency, the RAO.    As part of the Ecosystem content creators can register and license their content as a “programmed contract”directly to the “blockchain.” These contracts automate the collection and distribution of payments and remain in the control of the content creators. Users can access a global catalog of audio programs stored on RadioYo and can pay content creators directly using RadioYo’s digital currency (RAO).    Easy to use services and products also make up the decentralized Ecosystem allowing for a seamless experience for consumers, and access to RadioYo APIs via a developer marketplace gives developers entre to build AI, apps, bots, feeds, and algorithms on top of the platform.  Podcasters, online broadcasters, independent media and online publishers face a range of pressures every day. Funding, competition for listeners, press freedom, copyright infringement and producing the most remarkable programming possible weigh on people’s minds everyday. RadioYo is laying the groundwork for a new age of ownership, tracking, content sharing and creation that is engaging, sustainable, borderless, and fair to all stakeholders.  More information including our white paper is at http://rao.radioyo.fm
